metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11756 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Improper refcounting of soft token session objects could cause a use-after-free and crash (likely limited to a denial of service). This vulnerability affects Firefox < 71.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11756` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
